article: When I met him, I had a lot of anger inside of me.I never had a father, though in my neighborhood that's not _ .I know some kids just like me.You have to _ yourself. There are fights and killings all the time.I have friends who ended up in jail or pregnant.1 could have ended up that way, too, but Mr. Clark and my mom _ let that happen. Mr. Clark worked long hours, making sure I did my work.My grades rose.In fact, I did so well that in sixth grade, I entered the _ class, and Mr.Clark was the teacher.I felt so _ to have him for a second year! He took our class to see The Phantom of the Opera.Before the show, he _ us to dinner at a restaurant and taught us not to talk with our mouths full.We didn't want to let him _ , so we listened to him attentively. _ of us were surprised when Mr.Clark was selected as Disney's 2000 Teacher of the Year.When he learned he'd won, he said he would _ three names out of a hat; he would go to Los Angeles to get the _ with those students.But _ it came time to draw names, Mr.Clark said, "You're all going." He got _ to fly all 37 of us out to Disneyland in California and put us up at the Hilton.People were _ , but Mr.Clark really cared about us.There's no way I can _ most teachers doing that.No way.But he saw something in us that nobody else saw. On graduation day, there were a lot of tears.We didn't want his class to _ .In my new school year, we were all happy when Mr.Clark showed up .He's been a _ in our lives. In 2003, Mr.Clark took some of us on a trip to South Africa to _ school supplies and visit orphanages.It was the most amazing _ of my life.It's now my _ to one day start a group of women's clubs, helping people from all backgrounds.
